dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: ROLY POLY by Bob Wills and His Texas Playboys. The place is full of DRUNK LINE MEN, DRIFTERS, WEATHERED RANCHERS and a few ROUGH PROFESSIONAL WOMEN who flirt and dance. Young DICK CHENEY, 21, liquored up and playing dice, scre to the heavens in triumph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RED TAIL LIGHTS of a battered 1949 Frazer Sedan SWERV BACK AND FORTH ERRATICALLY. Dick is at the wheel. Very dr POLICE LIGHTS FLASH behind him.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: How you doing tonight?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: I need you to get out of the car. Dick gets out and IMMEDIATELY STUMBLES TO THE GROUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Older Cheney, 60, CONDOLEEZZA RICE and MARY MATALIN are watching CNN. ONE OF THE TWIN TOWERS IS SMOKING.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY A SECOND PLANE SOARS INTO FRAME AND HITS THE OTH
dialogues.text: TOWER. Everyone gasps.

dialogues.speaker: MOVE
dialogues.text: Secret Service Agent grabs Cheney and pushes him down th hall to the underground bunker.

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: (into ear piece) A plane just struck the Pentagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TV in a hair salon shows the 9/11 coverage. LYNNE CHENE 59, stares at the twin towers in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheney begins barking out orders.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: LetвЂ™s make sure the phone lines are working. SIVITS.

dialogues.speaker: CONDI RICE
dialogues.text: Phones are a go, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: LetвЂ™s contact the FAA. Find out how many planes are in the air. JUMP CUT: Cheney, on the phone amidst the chaos, NORMAN MINETA, DAVID ADDINGTON, Condi Rice, SCOOTER LIBBY, KAREN HUGHES and a few others are there.

dialogues.speaker: CONDI RICE
dialogues.text: (into phone) May I get the President on the line, please?

dialogues.speaker: STAFFER
dialogues.text: That's right. WeвЂ™ve got planes in the air and no where for them to land. The Twin Towers burn on the television as Dick lowers his head into his hands.

dialogues.speaker: CONDI RICE
dialogues.text: Mr. Vice President, POTUS on line 1. Council looks at Cheney as he is about to pick up a call POTUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, this situation is extremely fluid. I am strongly recommending you stay in the air. IвЂ™ve sequestered Congressional leadership and IвЂ™m coordinating our response with the White House team... Okay then... Dick hangs up and we reveal Lynne, now standing behind hi She has her hand on DickвЂ™s shoulder. He touches her han

dialogues.speaker: STAFFER
dialogues.text: Sir, Don Rumsfeld on 3. Cheney points to the speaker phone.

dialogues.speaker: CHENEY
dialogues.text: That? He picks up the line.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Dick, there are still passenger planes in the air. I need rules of engagement.

dialogues.speaker: CONDI RICE
dialogues.text: LetвЂ™s get the President back on the- Cheney holds up his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: You have authorization to shoot down any aircraft deemed a threat. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Presidential authority?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s correct. All orders are UNODIR.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN HUGHES
dialogues.text: Unless otherwise directed. FREEZE on Dick Cheney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (male, late 20's) By all accounts of what people saw in that room on that terrible day, there was confusion, fear, uncertainty, but Dick Cheney saw something else that no one else did... he saw an opportunity. Famous Photo of Men Playing Golf while the hillside behin them is on fire.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: As the world becomes more and more confusing, we tend to focus on the things that are right there in front of us. While ignoring the massive forces that actually change and shape our lives. VT and Stills of people working at Amazon and Wal-Mart.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And with people working longer and longer hours, for less and less wages, when we do have free time, the last thing we want is complicated analysis of our government, lobbying, international trade agreements. VT of people partying and dancing. Cheney clasps his hands thinking in the 9/11 Bunker.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So it's no surprise that when a monotone bureaucratic Vice President came to power. We hardly noticed. As he achieved a position of authority that very few leaders in the history of our nation ever have. Quick shots of the Iraq war, torture, the Senate passing cuts etc.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Forever changing the course of history for millions and millions of lives. And he did it like a ghost. With most people having no idea who he is or where he came from.  5. Lynne puts her hand on DickвЂ™s shoulder as we SMASH CUT Planes bombing a Middle Eastern Town with a ferocity. FADE TO BLACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Cheney fly fishes in a river ALONE. Working his rod the line... Over and over again.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: How does a man go on to become who he is? Well it starts in 1963.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG LYNNE CHENEY, in the back of a fancy car: Miss Must in a sparkled cowboy outfit waving at the crowd in SLO MO She's a cross between a movie star and a goddess.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: When Dick's best girl Lynne was getting straight A's at Colorado College,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Cheney passed out in bed. His sheets and floor cove in vomit.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Lynne had helped Dick get a scholarship at Yale, where he did way more drinking than class attending. Pretty soon Dick got the boot. So he went back home to Wyoming to work as a lineman for the state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick strapped to a pole works on power lines with a cigar in his mouth. ItвЂ™s rough hard work.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Back then they would have been called a guy like him a neвЂ™er-do- well. In todayвЂ™s parlance they would just call him a dirt bag.  In the distance, a Man SCREAMS. Dick looks down below.

dialogues.speaker: LINEMAN
dialogues.text: Man_down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linemen gather around a FALLEN MAN whoвЂ™s leg has snappe half, a bone sticking out of his torn pants.

dialogues.speaker: LINEMAN
dialogues.text: His leg looks like an Elvis dance move. The men laugh.

dialogues.speaker: LINEMAN
dialogues.text: Somebody give that poor son of a bitch a shot of whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: LINEMAN BOSS
dialogues.text: Alright, back to work. I SAID, Back to work! Everyone walks away except Cheney who continues to stare the writhing man. LINEMAN BOSS (CONTвЂ™D) (to Lineman #3) Take him into town, put $5 in his pocket. Find another man for tomorrow. (to Cheney) You got a problem Cheney?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: No sir. Cheney takes a drag of his smoke and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick dances around the bar drunk with a giant smile on hi face, taking shots and stumbling into other locals. A SHIFTY CREW MEMBER keeps putting his arm around DickвЂ™ shoulder. HeвЂ™s trying to agitate Cheney.

dialogues.speaker: SHIFTY CREW MEMBER
dialogues.text: Are we becoming friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you stop touching me?

dialogues.speaker: SHIFTY CREW MEMBER
dialogues.text: What you gonna do about it, Mr. Yale? Huh? Cheney slaps Crew MemberвЂ™s hand off his shoulder. SHIFTY CREW MEMBER (CONTвЂ™D) Woah! The fuck you gonna do about it, Mr. Yale? Come on! Dick shoves him back and PUNCHES HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From earlier, with the police officerвЂ™s help, Cheney st out of the car. The crackle of the police radio in the background. EXT. LYNNEвЂ™S HOUSE - THE NEXT MORNING A lower middle class home. A dog barks in the distance. INT. LYNNEвЂ™S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - SAME TIME

dialogues.speaker: COUCH.
dialogues.text: LYNNE, 21, pretty and sharp, stands over him with a fury her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Two times! Two times I had to drag you out of that jail like a filthy hobo! !

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Lynne...

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: What? What did you just say?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Lynney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sorry? DonвЂ™t call me вЂњLynney!вЂќ One time is вЂњIвЂ™m sorry.вЂќ Two times makes me think IвЂ™ve picked the wrong man! They kicked your ass out of Yale for drinking and fighting! Now are you just a lush who's going to hang power lines for the state? Are we going to live in a trailer and have ten children!? Is that the plan?! Dick looks like he might be sick.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Can we please... discuss this later?

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: No. We discuss it right now while you smell of piss and cheap booze! EDNA, LynneвЂ™s Mom, starts to walk in.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Does Dick want some coffee?

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Mother get out! Does Dick want some coffee? Jesus Christ! (back to Dick) Here's my plan. Either you stand up and put your back straight and have the courage to become someone or I am gone! There are a dozen men and a few Professors at school who would date me!

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I love you, Lynne. IвЂ™ve loved you since the day I first saw you.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Then prove it! I canвЂ™t go to a big Ivy League school! I canвЂ™t runa company or be Mayor! ThatвЂ™s just the way the world is for a girl! I need you! And right now youвЂ™re a big fat piss soaked zero! (beat while she reloads) IвЂ™ve seen my Mother waiting up all night for my Father to come home. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And IвЂ™ve seen him drunk in this house raising his voice and way worse, and IвЂ™m not dancing that dance anymore... IвЂ™m not! QUICK FLASH BACK to LynneвЂ™s FATHER yelling at her MOTHE the kitchen. Her dad is scary and has been drinking.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you change? Or am I wasting my goddamn time? Beat as Dick looks up. There is a GROWLING DETERMINATION HIS EYES.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I wonвЂ™t ever disappoint you again Lynne.

dialogues.speaker: QUOTE AGAINST BLACK
dialogues.text: вЂњBeware the quiet man. For while others speak, he watch And while others act, he plans. And when they finally rest...he strikes.вЂќ - ANONYMOUS

dialogues.speaker: OPENING TITLES
dialogues.text: Dick graduating from U of Wyoming. Dick and LynneвЂ™s Wedding Day. Lynne stands pregnant and Dick signs Vietnam Deferment papers. Dick drives into Washington D.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A theater with a podium is filled with FELLOWS from aroun the country. A MONOTONE CONGRESSMAN, 73 finishes a speech

dialogues.speaker: MONOTONE CONGRESSMAN
dialogues.text: You are AmericaвЂ™s best and brightest. God bless you all... and God bless... this great nation.  10. The 100 or so interns looked bored. A few clap politely. Cheney looks like heвЂ™s made a big mistake coming to DC. MONOTONE CONGRESSMAN (CONTвЂ™D) Next up is a young man from Illinois whoвЂ™s done quite well for himself here at the Capitol... Representative Donald Rumsfeld... DONALD RUMSFELD, 36, strides over with brash confidence. LIGHTS HIS PIPE and leans on the lectern.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: So did Bob tell you this internship is a great honor? Huh? Did he? A few people murmur yes. DONALD RUMSFELD (CONTвЂ™D) Well, itвЂ™s not. ItвЂ™s what we called in the Navy вЂњa shit detail.вЂќ THE ROOM LAUGHS. Dick Cheney laughs. Rumsfeld oozes chari FREEZE ON RUMSFELD.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Donald Rumsfeld, or Rummy as they called him, was the former captain of the Princeton wrestling team..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER 8 FOOTAGE: A 20 year old DONALD RUMSFELD, in wrestl singlet and head gear poses for camera in a wrestling pos moving his hands around, ready for a take down.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .+-and an elite navy jet pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER 8 FOOTAGE: 24 YR OLD RUMSFELD, in front of a jet pl removes his helmet, waves to camera and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Most Congressmen used their power like an axe, Rumsfeld used his like a master of the Butterfly knives. VT: We see expert hands flipping around a butterfly knife  11.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And like any master if you got in his way, he would cut you. vT: The knife slashes someoneвЂ™s cheek. UNFREEZE: Rumsfe continues his speech.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Look, this is an opportunity. An opportunity to work in the halls of decision making for the most powerful country in the goddamn world. If that doesnвЂ™t give you a hard on I donвЂ™t know what will. Sorry to the few ladies in the room. They used to not have girls for this program... but now they do. Anyway, IвЂ™m Don. Whatever you do, donвЂ™t work for Bob over here. HeвЂ™s the most boring son of a bitch in Dc. Bob chuckles, though it didnвЂ™t seem like good natured ribbing. DONALD RUMSFELD (CONTвЂ™D) ThatвЂ™s it. Now scat! Go get a Congressman a cup of coffee! And if his wife calls, heвЂ™s always ina meeting! The STUDENT next to Dick turns to him. HeвЂ™s got longish and a mustache.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: Hey, IвЂ™m Alan. YouвЂ™re the other guy from Wisconsin right?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: That's right...

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: One of us is supposed to start with a Democrat, the other with a Republican. Do you care if I go with the Dem? I did a lot of work with the DNC on campus.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: What party was that guy we just heard?  12.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: (looking at the directory) Rumsfeld is... a Republican.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Perfect. Because thatвЂ™s what I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheney knocks. Rumsfeld smoking a pipe, pours through pap He doesnвЂ™t answer. Cheney knocks again.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t lurk! Come in dammit! Cheney enters. Rumsfeld doesnвЂ™t look up as he talks to

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s, uh Dick Cheney... Reporting for work...

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: You're Congressional relations for my Office of Economic Opportunity. And you'll assist me in my job as councillor to the President. Cheney waits a beat. RUMSFELD (CONTвЂ™D) You want me to pin your mittens to your sleeves so you donвЂ™t fucking lose em? Go! Cheney starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: By the way Cheney, your two DUIs showed up on your background check. DonвЂ™t worry. I vouched for you.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Thank you sir.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Thanks are for when neighbor Dottie pulls your pud for the first time. You owe me.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.  13.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Go! Cheney nervously exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montage of Cheney working for Rumsfeld 1) Flipping Cards a Congressional Committee 2) Flipping cards for Senators Talking to a WHITE HOUSE MEDIA ADVISOR, 30, in a hallway.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIA CONSULTANT
dialogues.text: You're RumsfeldвЂ™s lackey right? Make sure he sees this.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roger Ailes, founder of FOX News. He first pitched the idea as conservative news when he worked for Nixon as a media advisor. UNFREEZE: Rumsfeld walks up as the Media Advisor leaves.

dialogues.speaker: DICK CHENEY
dialogues.text: Roger wants Nixon to start a Republican TV news network. Rumsfeld throws the memo in a waste basket.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Forget it. Roger knows TV. But he doesnвЂ™t know politics. 4) Dick and Lynne having dinner with Rumsfeld and his wif

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: So I would do this flaming baton trick and Dick would wait around with a bucket of water. So IвЂ™m at the State Finals and I throw up the baton....and it doesnвЂ™t come down.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Where have you been hiding her Cheney! ? 5) Flipping cards for Nixon in the Oval Office. 6) Flippi cards for cabinet members.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumsfeld continues down the hallway. Cheney follows.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: You're quiet. I like that. YouвЂ™re not blabbing to everyone what cards you have. I missed my flush draw a month ago but everyone still thinks I have pocket kings. Except maybe fucking Haldeman.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I mostly play hearts so IвЂ™m not-

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: No, no, no.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: For a man like Donald Rumsfeld he only wanted three things from his lackey: he had to keep his mouth shut, do what he was told and always be loyal. They stop by RumsfeldвЂ™s office.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: So is it a yes or a no? Half beat.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s a yes.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: You donвЂ™t even know what the question is do you?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I, uh, I assume it was-

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Good. That's exactly the kind of вЂњyesвЂќ I was looking for.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Cheney had always been a so so student and a mediocre athlete. But now finally he had found his life's calling, he would be a dedicated and humble servant to power. 14.  15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheney enters his office. ItвЂ™s basically a closet with desk, phone and a chair.

dialogues.speaker: STAFFER
dialogues.text: HereвЂ™s your new office. No windows. But all youвЂ™d see is a bunch of hippies flipping off Nixon. He sits down and picks up his phone.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now at this point you're probably wondering who exactly I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DAD, 29 and MOM, 28 play with their SON, 2, on the couc

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well my name is Kurt. My favorite football team is the Steelers. And me and my son love watching Sponge Bob. And if you are wondering how I know so much about Dick Cheney, well let's just say we are kind of related... WeвЂ™ll get to that later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick is talking to Lynne on the phone and beaming with pr

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Lynnie... guess where IвЂ™m calling from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynne is on the phone holding her new BABY MARY while LIZ now 3 plays in the background with the TV on. Intercut phone call:

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: I am so damn proud of you right now Dick Cheney... I knew I picked the right man. I knew it even when I didnвЂ™t...  16.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: We did it.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Have you seen Nixon?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I did. I met him. Shook his hand. That impish smile of his. FLASH TO ACTUAL STILL of Nixon with an odd smile posing f camera.

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pardon my French, but itвЂ™s the best fucking feeling in the world.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: I am so proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: WE are proud of you. Your girls are proud of you. (to girls) Are you proud of your Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG LIZ
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumsfeld and Cheney are walking down a hallway.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Now that IвЂ™m not just flipping cards, I have a few ideas--

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Stop. They both stop.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You see that door? He motions to an office door.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Isn't that Kissinger's office?  17.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Yes, but I happen to know that NixonвЂ™s in there right now. Now why would Nixon not meet Kissinger in the Oval Office?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™s having a conversation he doesnвЂ™t want to go on the record?

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Very good.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s the conversation?

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: They're going to bomb Cambodia.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: That's impossible. That would have to be approved by Congress and IвЂ™m over there every day-

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Fuck Congress. Unless you're in it. Then itвЂ™s the greatest deliberative body on earth. But weвЂ™re not, so fuck it.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I thought the President campaigned on ending the war?

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Shhhh. Listen to me... GLANCING PIECES OF NIXON AND KISSINGER TALKING: A cigaret being put out in an ash tray. A polished shoe tapping, et

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Because of the conversation Nixon and Kissinger are having right behind this door, five feet away from us... in a few days, 10 thousand miles away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A peaceful Cambodian Village goes about itвЂ™s day to day We hear a WHISTLING SOUND far above.  18.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: В«+. a rain of 750 pound bombs dropped from B-52s flying at twenty thousand feet will hit villages and towns across Cambodia...thousands will die and the world will change either for the worse or the better. We SNAP BACK TO THE HALLWAY. Cheney enthralled by the sen of power and reach Rumsfeld is expressing.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s the kind of power that exists in this squat little ugly building. But screw Kissinger, heвЂ™s over rated. Come on!

dialogues.speaker: MASSIVE EXPLOSION. WE SEE BLOOD AND LIMBS AND HEAR SCREAM
dialogues.text: JUST FOR A SPLIT SECOND, THEN CUT BACK to Cheney still looking at the office door. INT. WHITE HOUSE HALLWAY - RUMSFELDвЂ™S OFFICE - LATER Dick is struggling to ask Rumsfeld a question.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: So, uh, what do we... I mean are we against spending, or are we, uh...

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Come on... Out with it!

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: What do we, uh, believe? Rumsfeld starts to laugh and then laugh harder and harder

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: вЂњWhat do we believe?вЂќ Good one Cheney! Good one! He slams his door shut leaving Cheney standing in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick teaches the girls how to string worms on a fish hook  19.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: We find out what the fish wants, and in this case itвЂ™s a worm, and then we use it to catch them.

dialogues.speaker: 8YR OLD LIZ
dialogues.text: So is it a good trick weвЂ™re playing?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s not good or bad. ItвЂ™s fishing.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Dick had taken a job as a political consultant for a large financial firm, where he was finally making good money. He took the job because NixonвЂ™s inner circle had had enough of Donald Rumsfeld. INT. CHENEYвЂ™S BEDROOM - NIGHT - 1973 Dick and Lynne have just been awoken by the phone. They a dazed and tired.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: (on the phone) IвЂ™m out. TheyвЂ™re sending me to Brussels.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Wait, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumsfeld is tearing up papers and throwing them out.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: NixonвЂ™s making me permanent ambassador to NATO. ItвЂ™s a fuck off assignment. Kissinger and Haldeman won. Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I have a four and a seven year old.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Tell Don weвЂ™re not moving just because everyone at the White House hates him!  20.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Good boy. I taught you well these past few years.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry, Don. I really am.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t worry. IвЂ™m like bed bugs. You gotta burn the mattress to get rid of me! Don hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Dick was becoming sharper and sharper as a D.C. insider, and Lynne had started to write articles and explore ideas for her first novel. Lynne walks out across the backyard looking ashen.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Dick?... Something terrible has happened...

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then, she received news from back home in Casper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By a LARGE LAKE there is a car with both doors left open, purse scattered all over and two Dachshunds running aroun loose. Police Cars pull up in SLO MO with sirens blaring.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: LynneвЂ™s mother Edna, who had avoided the water her whole life, was found drowned in the local Caspar Lake. They said her and Wayne, LynneвЂ™s Dad, had had a nasty argument an hour before.  21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick holds Lynne in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: (in shock) She doesnвЂ™t swim, Dick. My Mother doesnвЂ™t swim. She never swam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About 20 MOURNERS including Lynne, Dick, DickвЂ™s parents and Mary and yes, Wayne, LynneвЂ™s Father listen to a pri read from the Bible as a coffin is lowered into the groun

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: There was never a serious investigation into Lynne's Mom's death.

dialogues.speaker: THE FUNERAL HAS ENDED. WAYNE IS TRYING TO DO A HANDSTAND
dialogues.text: LIZ AND MARY. Lynne stops him.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Dad...Dad... Dick walks over.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Girls, Lynne. Why donвЂ™t you go to the car.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: (raspy from crying) Come on. Listen to your Father. They leave. Dick is intense.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Heya Dick. You catching any fish? THERE IS A RESOLUTE LOOK IN DICKвЂ™S EYES. He stares at W WAYNE (CONTвЂ™D) HowвЂ™s it going in DC?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t ever go near my daughters or my wife again. A tense beat. Then Wayne finally walks away.  22.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (yells) Big shot! Big shot in D.C. Dick! Dick stares straight ahead. He has a resolute quiet power about him. He can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP: a basket of plain brown donuts, flaking croissa and one GLORIOUS DANISH WITH A BRIGHT YELLOW CENTER. HANDS REACH IN and take a few brown donuts, a croissant. THEY STAY AWAY FROM THE DANISH WITH THE YELLOW CENTER. Finally, Cheney TAKES THE LARGE TREAT. FOUR WHITE MEN IN

dialogues.speaker: SUITS
dialogues.text: WOLFOWITZ) ages 35 to 55, all wait for him to speak. The is his.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: So what do you got? The Unseen ManвЂ™s hand flips through papers marked CLASS

dialogues.speaker: CIA AGENT
dialogues.text: (slightly nervous) Hassan Mustafa Nasr. A cleric based in Milan, Italy. HeвЂ™s a member of Al-GamaвЂ™s al-Islamiyya, the group that killed Anwar Sadat.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s the blind sheik, right?

dialogues.speaker: CIA AGENT
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s some debate at Langley on whether theyвЂ™re a threat or not. They claim to be peaceful now. He holds up the danish heвЂ™s eating.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I вЂњclaimвЂќ to be eating healthy. Everyone laughs a bit too hard.

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay... pick him up.  23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV: A DOOR OF A VAN SLAMS OPEN: A CLERIC, 40, with beard wearing a Muslim tagiyah (cap) walks down an Italian stre

dialogues.speaker: CLERIC
dialogues.text: NOO! Help! Help me! QUICK CUTS: 1. Scissors slice off the ClericвЂ™s clothes is struck hard in the face 3. A black hood is put over hi terrified bloodied face. 4. A diaper is then put on him. THE VAN DRIVES AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s the next name?

dialogues.speaker: CIA AGENT
dialogues.text: Well Mr. Vice President, thereвЂ™s been some chatter about an engineering student in Berlin...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD NIXON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I have never been a quitter. INT. CHENEYвЂ™S LIVING ROOM - 1974 - DAY TV in the CheneyвЂ™s living room shows Nixon resigning as President.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD NIXON, (SOT)
dialogues.text: But I must put the interests of the nation first...

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Nixon forgot the voice activated recorders were there. He got sloppy.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Mom, is the President being punished?  24.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: The President has a lot of enemies. Never forget Lizzy: when you get power they always try and take it from you. Always.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Yes MвЂ™am. Dick dials the phone.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Donald Rumsfeld please...

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: I canвЂ™t believe this, this is our President. This is a tragedy!

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I actually think this could be very, very good news. MUSIC: Kicking 70вЂ™s horns come in. This is starting to like good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumsfeld gets into CheneyвЂ™s beat up black VW Bug in the airport parking lot. Both toss their cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s your read on things?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: The way I see it, any Republican not touched by Watergate is golden right now.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Nice. Ford called me right before my flight took off. (sees black bug) You're still driving this chick magnet, huh?

dialogues.speaker: CHENEY
dialogues.text: You can always take the bus. CLOSE UP ON TELEVISION.  25.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD NIXON, (SOT)
dialogues.text: Effective immediately I will resign the Presidency of the United States and Vice President Ford will be sworn in tomorrow at noon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both are smoking again as they pull up to the White House

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: So whatвЂ™s the plan?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: The plan? Well the plan is to take over the damn place...

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Who lit a fire under your ass?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I haven't flipped cards in a long time Don.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: They gave me the damn keys to the palace! He pours two Glenlivet neats.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Chief of Staff.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Holy shit. You salty son of a bitch. You did it. They clink and drink.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Now we have work to do. Kissinger is trying to kiss and make up with the Soviets.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Well, letвЂ™s make sure that shit doesnвЂ™t happen.  26.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: (laughing) Yeah. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford talks with Kissinger, Rumsfeld and Cheney.

dialogues.speaker: CHENEY
dialogues.text: If I may, I believe I may have a way to put an ore in the water, on Russia. What if-

dialogues.speaker: KISSINGER
dialogues.text: Mr. President-

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Come on Henry letвЂ™s hear Dick out.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: One of Dick CheneyвЂ™s super powers, was the ability to make the most wild and extreme ideas sound measured and professional.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: What if on a unilateral basis, we all put miniature wigs on our penises, and we walked out to the White House lawn, and we jerked each other off. So, like a puppet show, but much more enjoyable? Long pause. Rumsfeld smiles a sly grin.

dialogues.speaker: KISSINGER
dialogues.text: I do like a good puppet show.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: I say we do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're calling it the Halloween Massacre. Donald Rumsfeld has replaced Secretary of Defense James Slessinger. And Dick Cheney has been chosen as the--  27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynne spins around her husband's well appointed office.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: --the youngest Chief of Staff in history! ItвЂ™s like a dream.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s real. And Don is the youngest Secretary of Defense ever.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Well, IвЂ™m not talking about Don, IвЂ™m talking about you. And IвЂ™m going to give you a kiss, right her in the White House. She holds Dick. They kiss. A SECRET SERVICE AGENT peeks in the door with Liz and Mar tow.

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: Excuse me Mr. and Mrs. Cheney. These girls tried to enter the Oval Office. They run into DickвЂ™s arms.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Oh dear!

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Girls this is not a playground, please do not--

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Daddy! Is this where Santa lives?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Better than Santa. ItвЂ™s where the leader of the greatest nation on earth lives!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Are you one of his elves Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: In a way, yes.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: No heвЂ™s not Mary. Your Father is Chief of Staff. Chief. Of Staff. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to him) Dick, if youвЂ™re silly with her she'll grow up to be a silly woman.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Right of course, I forgot, thatвЂ™s just silly, Mary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheney talks to a YOUNG LAWYER at the OLC.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And as the new Chief of Staff and with the Presidency weakened by Watergate, Dick Cheney wanted to find out exactly how much power did the President have.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I would like to reinstate Executive Authority. How?

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Antonin Scalia, a young lawyer with the justice department who would later go on to serve on the Supreme Court, rocked DickвЂ™s world.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG LAWYER
dialogues.text: Have you heard of the theory of the unitary executive?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: No, tell me about it.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG LAWYER
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s an interpretation a few, like myself happen to believe, of Article two of the Constitution that vests the President with absolute executive authority. And I mean absolute. 28.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Cheney and Scalia both smile. This is what Cheney has bee looking for. MUSIC: GLORIOUS ORCHESTRAL STING. VT footage of a Lion chasing a gazelle and catching it.  29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Narrator Dad plays with his son on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: (to wife) Honey, you wanna get Cole up to the high chair? I gotta explain this to the people.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: (picking up son) Come on buddy!

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Unitary Executive Theory. Certain legal scholars believe that if the President does anything it must be legal because itвЂ™s the President. To hell with checks and balances, especially during times of war. This was the power of kings, pharaohs, dictators,

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Dick Cheney was a foot soldier in the power games of Washington DC, but with the Unitary Executive Theory, he could become Galactus, devourer of planets, Image of the super villain... GALACTUS NARRATOR (CONTвЂ™D) But then it was Election Day and there was one big problem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford, Betty Ford, Cheney, Lynne, Rumsfeld watch the retur on ABC NEWS with BARBARA WALTERS and HARRY REASONER. Chen is chain smoking. They all sip cocktails.

dialogues.speaker: TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: reports Carter winning presidential election  30.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA WALTERS, (SOT)
dialogues.text: ..-Which means that Jimmy Carter is the next President of the United States.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And just like that it was all over.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: That canвЂ™t be right. It got to be some sort of a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Well...there goes the neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: (his voice is horse) Thank you everybody.

dialogues.speaker: TV REPORTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Republicans have lost the Presidency, they are the minority in Congress and in most states. With America demanding change, I donвЂ™t see a future for the GOP. They are the party of the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maintenance workers install giant solar panels on the roo the White House.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID BRINKLEY, (SOT)
dialogues.text: President Carter went to the roof of the White House today to announce his new solar initiative... VT President Carter speaking to the press.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT CARTER, (SOT)
dialogues.text: We must end our dependence on fossil fuels. And by the using the energy God gave us in the sun, we may have an endless source of power with solar energy...  31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheney trudges through a river with fishing gear in hand slo-mo. He is older, unsteady, but determined and focused

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VFW IN A ONE STOP SIGN TOWN. A beat up Winnebago with a shabby вЂњCheney for Congress!вЂќ on it parked out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheney speaks to RANCHERS at a VFW. ItвЂ™s hot.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: .-+-I will become the gentleman from Wyoming. And hear this, taxes must come down. Lynne coaches from the back of the room.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: (whispers ) Talk. Talk.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I'll say it again, taxes must go down, we must ameliorate pain for the taxes of the working man....and bring perspicacity to the fore. Lynne watches, pained. HeвЂ™s not good at this. The Campa Manager leans in.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPAIGN MANAGER
dialogues.text: (whispers ) Thank God for name recognition.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: But enough of the horsing around. Which is of course, what us cowboys do. So uh, remember, vote Cheney for Congress. Uhh, thank you and vote for Cheney in Congress.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Either he drinks next time, or I do.  32. Crowd applauds tepidly. Dick walks over to Lynne and his Campaign Manager. HeвЂ™s rubbing his arm.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t want anyone to panic. But I do believe I have to go to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: BEATING ERRATICALLY BEFORE FINALLY IT STOPS.
dialogues.text: QUICK CUT: A CUCKOO CLOCK STRIKING TWELVE: A cuckoo pops

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheney is in bed, IV coming out of his arm, heart monitor beeping. Lynne is there by his side. A DOCTOR, 39.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s an inferior wall infarct.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: But it can be fixed, right?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: If it was up to me youвЂ™d drop out of the election. But youвЂ™ve both made it clear thatвЂ™s not an option. So you must have a minimum of two weeks bed rest.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Two weeks off. WeвЂ™ll lose our lead.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: The hell we will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A microphone stand on the back of a truck and a crowd of fifty HARD FACED MALE FARMERS AND RANCHERS waiting. A goo boy RANCH OWNER, 59, intros.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: Dick Cheney has an illness so he canвЂ™t be here today. But we have his wife and a heck of a pretty gal here to fill in: Lynne Cheney! Lynne walks up to the Podium. SHE IS TOO SMALL TO REACH T MICROPHONE. THE CROWD LAUGHS. Lynne takes the mic off.  33.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: I grew up in Wyoming. But somewhere along the line Washington DC stopped listening to real folks like us! And started only listening to liberal snobs who want us all to lose our jobs to affirmative action! Awkward silence. The Campaign Manager tries to usher her

dialogues.speaker: CAMPAIGN MANAGER
dialogues.text: Okay Lynne... The crowd EXPLODES in applause. Lynne pushes the Manager' hand away.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: When I was in New York City I saw women burning their bras. Well you know what women do with bras in Wyoming? We wear them! Crowd applauds lustily again. The Campaign Manager looks around вЂњWhat the hell is happening?вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VAN weaves through a windy dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Here in Wyoming we believe there is a right and a wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Ladies Auxiliary Meeting. Some women knit as Lynne give speech.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Because IвЂ™m a mom and a wife from Wyoming. And I know how it feels to make every penny count. And not only do I speak for you, my husband Dick Cheney... Crowd livens up, applauding hard.  34.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A hard wind of change had been blowing through America, civil rights, Roe versus Wade, environmentalism. But there was a part of the country that didnвЂ™t like this change and wanted it to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynne and Dick toast to a table of CONGRESSMEN AND WIVES.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Thanks to my amazing wife, it is good to be joining you all here in D.C. as WyomingвЂ™s sole Congressional Representative! Everyone smiles and toasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUTS OF: OLD MONEY PATRIARCHS getting out of limos in SLO

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And then big money families like the Kochs and the Coors that were sick of paying income taxes, rolled into Washington DC and started writing fat checks to fund right wing think tanks... QUICK CUTS: the Heritage Foundation, the American Enterpr Institute, the CATO Institute, ALEC, etc.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...that would change the way many Americans looked at the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU of a document on a desk: вЂњTRICKLE DOWN ECONOMICS: A on reduced top tax rates as stimulus.вЂќ PULL OUT to reveal a giant office with dozens of desks an PEOPLE. A BIG SIGN READS вЂњTHE AMERICAN ENTERPRISE INSTI LITTLE LINES TYPE IN THE AIR OVER EACH DESK: вЂњWelfare F AmericaвЂ™s Hidden EpidemicвЂќ вЂњOIL AND COAL: AMERICAвЂ вЂњRegulations Are Costing us Billions!вЂќ  35.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Finally in 1980, this unlikely revolution of the super rich and white conservatives found its face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VT. STOCK: RONALD REAGAN giving his ACTUAL nomination spe

dialogues.speaker: REAGAN
dialogues.text: For those who have abandoned hope, we'll restore hope, and we'll welcome them into a great national crusade... to make America great again! Crowd goes NUTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WORKERS unscrew solar panels from the roof and discard th into a pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheney walks confidently talking to Congressmen and Aides

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: It was the fucking 1980's, and it was a hell of a time to be Dick Cheney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: вЂњNAYвЂќ VOTES COMING UP ON THE BIG BOARD AGAINST A SEA вЂњYEAвЂќ VOTES.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Vote on the Undetectable fire arms Act to ban вЂњplastic guns that can evade metal detectorsвЂќ... Clean water act... endangered species act... School lunch program...Martin Luther King Jr federal holiday... ACTUAL CLIPS of Nancy Reagan on Mr. TвЂ™s lap, Donald Tru Aerobics.  36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick COLLAPSES IN THE HALLWAY, going to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone call an ambulance!! (to Cheney) Can you breathe?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m having a heart attack you idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White House CHRISTMAS PARTY. REAGAN AND NANCY (from behin meet and greet celebrities, leaders and friends like Roya REVEAL: Lynne and Cheney ENTER like a Duke and Duchess. D looks dashing in a tux and Lynne stunning in a tasteful g ON SCREEN: вЂњDick Cheney House Minority Whip 1989вЂќ and Cheney Chair of the National Endowment for the Humanitite 1986-1993вЂќ Quick shots of people at the party CATCHING GLIMPSES OF T CHENEYS, some whisper, some smile.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: (finishing a conversation) Thank you... IвЂ™m very excited. The couple she was talking to walks away.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're both brilliant, but broke. VICE PRESIDENT GEORGE BUSH SR. walks up.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE BUSH SR
dialogues.text: Hey Dick... Hello Lynne. Congratulations on your appointment.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Why thank you Mr. Vice President. How is your lovely family?  37.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE BUSH SR
dialogues.text: My son Jeb seems cut out for office. We may be asking you for endorsements in a few years.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: If heвЂ™s half as charming as you George, heвЂ™s got both our votes.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE BUSH SR
dialogues.text: Dick. I just wanted to say thank you for getting the House not to override the President's veto of the fairness doctrine.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Not a problem. Happy to get rid of any big government regulations.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The fairness doctrine was a law from the forties that required any broadcast TV or radio news to present both sides of an issue equally. Its repeal would lead to the rise of opinion news.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK CLIPS OF MORTON DOWNEY JR, RUSH LIMBAUGH, AND THEN
dialogues.text: GIANT FOX NEWS ANIMATED LOGO вЂњFAIR AND BALANCED.вЂќ INT. NEWSROOM вЂ”- MODERN DAY

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR
dialogues.text: (To camera) ... And eventually to the realization of Roger AilesвЂ™ dream: Fox News. Which would go on to dominate all other news and swing America even more to the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNFREEZE: ThereвЂ™s a CRASH on the other side of the part see a LANKY DRUNK GUY whoвЂ™s knocked over a tray of cham glasses. A waitress is distraught.  38.

dialogues.speaker: LANKY DRUNK GUY
dialogues.text: Lighten up sweetie! ItвЂ™s a party!

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s that fellaвЂ™s problem?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE BUSH SR
dialogues.text: Let me go see if everythingвЂ™s okay over there. Great to see you both. Love to the girls... George goes over to the young drunk man and ushers him ou

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: (quietly) ThatвЂ™s his son. George W. HeвЂ™s the black sheep of the family.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: A little too much unconditional love.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Can you feel it Dick? Half the room wants to be us and the other half fears us. I know George is up next but after that, who knows? She rubs her hand against his back.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: (takes it in) I respect the hell out of Reagan... But no oneвЂ™s really shown the world the true power of the American Presidency...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY CHENEY, now 17, leaves school SOBBING HARD. A TEACHE FOLLOWS HER.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: Excuse me Ms. Cheney! You cannot leave the grounds during school hours! Mary! Come back! She jumps in her 85 Honda Accord, tears out.

dialogues.speaker: MARY CHENEY
dialogues.text: No, no, no!!!  39. Mary speeds through a stop sign and BAM!! IS HIT BY ANOTH CAR! She is dazed with blood coming down her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary, in a hospital bed. Dick and Lynne are there.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: I just donвЂ™t understand. You left school? Why? It doesnвЂ™t make sense.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: It was Susan...

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Your best friend? Were you fighting over a boy?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: She broke up with me... Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mom, Dad, I like girls... IвЂ™m gay. Dick and Lynne are silent for a long time. Everything the worked for hangs in the balance. Finally Dick moves towar Mary and hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: It doesnвЂ™t matter sweetheart. We will always love you no matter what.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Oh, I love you so much Daddy...

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: (tearing up) ItвЂ™s just going to be... so hard for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt the Narrator, drives an electric pallet cart.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: When George Bush Sr. was elected President, Dick Cheney was made Secretary of Defense. Sixth in line to the Presidency.  40. Kurt the Narrator parks his cart and moves some boxes. NARRATOR (CONTвЂ™D) And after a few years, it was DickвЂ™s turn to run for President, so they decided to do some early polling numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP: early poll results in CheneyвЂ™s hands. They sh dead_last behind 11 other Republicans including Dan Quayl

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Well I guess thatвЂ™s it. Lynne is there.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: We can move those numbers. We attack the welfare state, regulations, government waste...

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™ll be a war. I canвЂ™t put Mary through that. Every primary opponent will go after her...

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: We deny. Shame them for going after the family... He crumples the paper, leaves it on the table and exits. Lynne looks at the paper.

dialogues.speaker: CHENEY WALKS ACROSS THE DESERT WITH THE FAMILY OF SAUD.
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN: вЂњDick Cheney would go on to become CEO of a oil service company: HalliburtonвЂќ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick, Mary, now 30, her partner HEATHER POE and Liz, 33 a her HUSBAND PHILIP (holding a newborn) with Lynne, all fi and sit by a beautiful lake. A GRAND DAUGHTER KATE, 4, ru around laughing with 2 DOGS.  41. ON SCREEN: вЂњLynne would publish several books on Americ History.вЂќ Dick holds his newborn grand daughter and laughs with fam ON SCREEN: вЂњDick had a choice between the Presidency of United States and his youngest daughter. He chose his daughter.вЂќ Mary chases Lynne with the fish, everyone laughs. ON SCREEN: вЂњThe Cheneys would never again enter politic the public eye.вЂќ ON SCREEN: вЂњLynne and Dick are happy and wealthy and li Virginia where they breed award-winning Golden Retrievers The Cheneys walk together up to the their house for suppe

dialogues.speaker: END CREDITS ROLL
dialogues.text: SFX: Is that a phone ringing?

dialogues.speaker: END CREDITS CONTINUE TO ROLL
dialogues.text: The Phone ringing gets LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A desk phone is ringing as Dick, now in his early 60вЂ™s towards it.

dialogues.speaker: DICK CHENEY
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. IвЂ™m coming...

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Who's calling on a Sunday morning?!

dialogues.speaker: DICK CHENEY
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know! He answers.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Hello. Cheney residence?... Uh- huh...I understand... Anyway I can be of assistance... Okay... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That should work... 3pm... Of course... That goes without saying... He hangs up and stands there for a second. Lynne comes walking out of the kitchen. Beat. Beat. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Who was it?!

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: It was someone from George BushвЂ™s sonвЂ™s campaign.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Jeb?

dialogues.speaker: DICK CHENEY
dialogues.text: No. George W... JebвЂ™s Florida.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Right. I still canвЂ™t believe they've got that poor boy running for President.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what did they want?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: They want to talk to me about being his running mate.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: They didnвЂ™t say it outright but IвЂ™ve made that call myself and thatвЂ™s what they want.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Vice President is a nothing job.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m just going to hear them out. I owe his Father that...  43.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: VP just waits for the President to die. YouвЂ™ve said it yourself.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s just a meeting.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Is it just a meeting? Or is it just a meeting?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s just a meeting.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Good. She walks away. Cheney stands there still in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU: CheneyвЂ™s polished shoes. He reaches for a copy of T Magazine: The Cover a picture of Bush with the headline вЂњPresident Bush?вЂќ A receptionist, THERESA, 28 approac

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: The Governor will see you now Secretary Cheney.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU of W BushвЂ™s hand as it shakes CheneyвЂ™s. A signed N Ryan baseball on a shelf, papers on the desk with a copy Sports Illustrated, Cheney lowering himself into a chair, Bush tapping his finger on the desk to an unheard beat.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: Hello Dick.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Hello George.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s been awhile.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Since last year. The foreign policy sessions... We see GEORGE W BUSH, 53. Handsome but boyish with a petu fidgety edge to him.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: That's right. Those meetings were very engaging. I remember we both agreed my Dad would have been re- elected if he had taken out Saddam.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: War time Presidents are always popular.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: That they are. That they are.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: So... Congratulations on a successful primary. IвЂ™ve been through a few myself and they can be... Shall we say-

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: Fucking exhausting?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: (chuckles lightly) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: Buses, bologna sandwiches. I mean I like people but enoughвЂ™s enough. Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: (and then) So uh, the call I received...

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: I forgot, youвЂ™re a brass tacks guy arenвЂ™t you? I like that. Are you surprised IвЂ™m running for President? After my, shall we say, wild years?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I sowed some oats myself back in the day. Still enjoy a cold beer on occasion.  45.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: I bet you did. I bet you did you rascal. Well I canвЂ™t anymore. It got bad... Real bad.

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What does he really want? What does he need?

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: Do you want some brisket? Theresa can we get some brisket?!

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Yes sir!

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: Get the burnt ends!

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: George... Listen...

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: (changes gears nervously) So listen, IвЂ™ve got a lack of experience problem in the polls and you're one of the most experienced guys around. You wanna jump on board and be my Vice? QUICK FLASH: CheneyвЂ™s fishing line in a RIVER. He watch water with a patient focus.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: ...IвЂ™m honored.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t be honored. Fucking say yes Mr. Brass tacks.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: ...-I have to say no at this time.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: Come on. I know you love politics. What are you in the private sector now? Come on...

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I canвЂ™t.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s a shame. It is. I really need you near my campaign.  46. Beat. QUICK FLASH: a satchel is opened revealing fly fish lures of all shapes and sizes.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Perhaps... I, uh, could help you find the right running mate?

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: You mean run my VP search team?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: No team. Me.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. That could work. IвЂ™11l have to run it by Rove of course. (and then) This campaignвЂ™s gonna be a bitch. But if I lose I can maybe become commissioner of baseball, you know?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: But the idea is to win, right?

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m going to keep you in the back of my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick and Lynne brush and floss and prepare for bed. After long beat Lynne finally speaks.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: So are you going to tell me how it went today or not?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: It was... interesting. He is a...green. HeвЂ™s very green. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: And you told him no?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I told him IвЂ™d help with the search. Beat. Dick gargles Listerine for a very long time. Painfu long.  47.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: What are you thinking? I can tell you're thinking.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What was Dick Cheney thinking?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m thinking IвЂ™ve never seen anything like this.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: After his first meeting with George Ww.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: We've had a lot of successes Dick. Vice President is a nothing job.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: How many steps ahead was he looking? How did he feel about the opportunity that was in front of him? Cheney stares in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There are certain moments, that are so delicate. Like a teacup and saucer... FLASH BACK of Dick hugging Lynne and the children after t found out LynneвЂ™s Mom died.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Stacked on a teacup and saucer... FLASH BACK of Lynne yelling at young Dick as he sits hung on the couch with his head hung in shame. NARRATOR (CONTвЂ™D) Stacked on a teacup and saucer.... Back to Dick and Lynne in the bathroom. NARRATOR (CONTвЂ™D) And on and on. That this moment could fall in any direction and change everything. FLASH TO Tea cups wobbling as they are stacked higher and higher.  48.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sadly there is no real way to know exactly what was going on with the Cheneys at this history changing moment. We canвЂ™t just snap into a Shakespearian Soliloquy that dramatizes every feeling and emotion. ThatвЂ™s just not the way the world works. CUT TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: You know what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick and Lynne get settled into bed.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: My sweet Richard. DanceвЂ™d nimbly round the KingвЂ™s hearth thou hath. Even whilst clamored I for more, more! Parched maw craned towards the drip, drip of imagined waters. But I say to you now, rest, retire. Thou hast honored thy vows to wife and crown.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Has blindness usurped vision in you my wife? No mere treaty is our union! Thou shared thy torchвЂ™s flame with mine. Revealing halls and spires of long faded empires. But now I hold aloft mine own fiery cresset To make flesh our bond of power.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Dare I? Dare I let hopeвЂ™s beak place gathered bramble Upon my heart for futureвЂ™s nest? Many winters past hath I let this hope die, cruel winds silencing tiny birds needy cries (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now that it hath arrived I say yea, yea! Mine own blood and will, are yours til pierced be the last soldier's breast plate, spilling open its jellied ruby treasures! Lightening Strikes as they embrace and kiss passionately. CUT TO BLACK. Back to the Bedroom with non-Shakespeare Dick and Lynne. beat of silence.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: So...I think we proceed.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: What about Mary?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s VP. ItвЂ™s not the same scrutiny. Dick rolls over, finally ready to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™s got allies Dick... Connections. YouвЂ™re new to his world. You donвЂ™t know the landscape.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Well, then I had better run a very thorough search...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz, Lynne, Mary, Dick's friend DAVID GRIBBIN and Dick wo on the VP questionnaire. Laptops, papers are everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Every stone. Hell, every grain of sand needs to be looked under for this questionnaire. Mary is putting pizzas on the table.  50.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID GRIBBIN
dialogues.text: Dick weвЂ™re asking for all financials, all medical, all interviews, press, writings, legal records, family medical and family financials. Any more вЂњcomprehensiveвЂќ and weвЂ™d need a rubber glove. Sorry Liz.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: That wasnвЂ™t offensive. Should I be offended?

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m offended Dave wasnвЂ™t worried I'd be offended.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Oh, a rubber glove. Like a proctology exam. ThatвЂ™s...thatвЂ™s disgusting. The phone rings. Dick answers.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Hey David. Any thoughts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David Addington at his desk, phone crookвЂ™d in his neck.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ADDINGTON
dialogues.text: One big one.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: David Addington, Dicks main legal advisor and a huge believer in the Unitary Executive Theory. He was known for telling people to their face that they were stupid.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ADDINGTON
dialogues.text: So the Vice Presidency is part of the executive branch and because the VP casts tie breaking votes in the Senate, also part of the legislative branch, right?  51.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Okay?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ADDINGTON
dialogues.text: That means the VP is also not part of the executive or the legislative.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: So one could argue neither branch has oversight of the VP?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Not only can вЂњoneвЂќ argue that, IвЂ™m arguing it right now.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Brilliant David.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ADDINGTON
dialogues.text: I know! Right?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. CRAWFORD RANCH вЂ”- DAY Cheney and W walk towards a porch with a screen door slig ajar at WвЂ™s Crawford Ranch.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: Rove made me buy this ranch. He wanted to distance me from my years at Yale and Harvard. Make me more of a man of the people for the election.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Smart. They sit. W BUSH eats chicken while Cheney sips his ice t

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: So, we gonna do this thing or what? Is this happening?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: We've found some very interesting candidates. I think if we could schedule a three hour window to go through each one-  Beat. 52.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: No. I meant are you going to be my VP? I want you.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m CEO of a large company. IвЂ™ve been Secretary of Defense, Chief of Staff... The Vice Presidency is a mostly symbolic job...

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: Right, right. I can see how that wouldn't be enticing to you.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: However... the Vice Presidency is also defined by the President. If we were to have a... different understanding...

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Go on. QUICK FLASH: a fishing line going TIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I get the sense youвЂ™re a, shall we say, kinetic leader. You make decisions based on instinct. YouвЂ™re very different from your father in that regard.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: (he likes that) I am. People have always said that.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Maybe I could handle the more mundane parts of the job. Managing the bureaucracy, overseeing the military, energy, foreign policy...

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: That sounds good. QUICK FLASH: a fishing line reels out for another catch. W BUSH (CONTвЂ™D) I never want to be the kind of team owner that pulls the starter in the 4th inning. ThatвЂ™s the manager's job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And one last thing. My daughter Mary...

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: Right... Rove told me she likes girls.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I know you'll have to run against gay marriage for the south and the mid-west. But itвЂ™s my daughter and that line in drawn in concrete.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: So long as you donвЂ™t mind us pushing that messaging. Sure, we're okay with you sitting that one out. I think itвЂ™s important for all the Marys in the world, you know? No problemo.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Then I believe this can work. W raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: Hot Damn! Well good, letвЂ™s celebrate! They cheers ice tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACKSTAGE: Dick and Lynne wait behind the curtains while hear W Bush speaking.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: When I was searching for a Vice President I turned to the experience of Dick Cheney. But I soon realized he was the best choice. Please welcome, my friend and my running mate: Dick Cheney! And his lovely wife Lynne! The Cheneys enter. On stage we see DickвЂ™s shoes walk to the podium. A quick flash of the campaignвЂ™s slogan on t podium: вЂњRENEWING AMERICAвЂ™S PURPOSEвЂќ  54.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Dick never filled out his own 83 question questionnaire. Full medical records were never handed over. No tax or corporate filings, nothing. Crowd starts chanting вЂњCheney! Cheney!вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN: November 7, 2000, Bush vs. Gore Room full of people watching the election results: Don an Joyce Rumsfeld, Lynne, Mary and Heather, Liz and Philip, Addington, Wolfowitz etc. In the back of the room Dick ta to SCOOTER LIBBY.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY
dialogues.text: Gore rescinded his concession. They're claiming Florida is too close to call.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: He canвЂ™t fucking rescind his concession.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY
dialogues.text: He just did. ThereвЂ™s going to be a recount. What should we do? Half beat as Cheney processes.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: We play it like weвЂ™ve already won. Which means we need to staff the White House.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY
dialogues.text: Who's leading the transition team?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY
dialogues.text: Um, thatвЂ™s not really something a Vice President does, is it?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: It is now. News reporting on election results.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gore has called Governor Bush and retracted his concession. The room erupts. вЂњNo!вЂќ вЂњHe canвЂ™t do that!вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Addington, Liz, Mary, Lynne, Dick and AIDES work amidst t of folders, files, cell phones in the Cheney kitchen..

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Wolfowitz. State or Pentagon?

dialogues.speaker: ADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Depends on who your Secretary of Defense is.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Rummy.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Rumsfeld?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: DoesnвЂ™t Bush Sr. hate Rummy?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s not a bad thing with W. He wants to be his own man. Dick checks his blackberry.

dialogues.speaker: ADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Rumsfeld believes in a robust Executive. ThatвЂ™s good for us on war powers.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: (joking) Just keep him out of state, he'll start World War three.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Halliburton gave us a 26 million dollar exit package. Twice as much as we were hoping for.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: TheyвЂ™re no dummies.  56. Cheney wiggles two fingers around on his right hand.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Uh. Sorry gang. But I think perhaps... I should go to the hospital...

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Oh no. Are you kidding me? Everyone circles around Dick.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: Oyez! Oyez! Oyez! All persons having business before the Honorable, the Supreme Court of the United States, are admonished to draw near and give their attention, for the Court is now sitting. God bless the United States and this Honorable Court. The Justices enter, sit. Whip pan reveal: JUSTICE SCALIA.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: December 12th 2000. Antonin Scalia, remember him? And the Supreme Court stopped the state of Florida from completing their recount. Clips of Washington D.C.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: George W Bush and Dick Cheney were going to the Whitehouse by a margin of 537 votes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheney walks the halls of the White House alone. He stops at a CLOSED DOOR. Looks at it. REACHES OUT AND T THE HANDLE. Reveal: THE EMPTY OVAL OFFICE.  57. Dick doesn't enter but looks at the office for a long bea As he stands there we FLASH BACK TO THE DAY DICK FIRST GO HIS OWN OFFICE IN THE NIXON WHITE HOUSE AND CALLED LYNNE.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG DICK
dialogues.text: (to baby Mary on phone) Hey little Mary. My little Mary. How are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG LYNNE
dialogues.text: They're both doing really well. Except IвЂ™m trying to make this dinner and itвЂ™s this, uh, Macaroni and Cheese that they said was easy, but it just keeps coming out a little watery.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG DICK
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s the milk, remember. You gotta add more milk. Yep, make it thicker.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG LYNNE
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s so much I want to say right now. You just keep doing what you're doing. YouвЂ™re doing so great. They laugh. YOUNG LYNNE (CONTвЂ™D) You have earned something very special from your wife.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG DICK
dialogues.text: Listen! Listen! IвЂ™m buying wine and IвЂ™m picking something up. Chinese?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG LYNNE
dialogues.text: I really love you.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG DICK
dialogues.text: I love you. They laugh and giggle. And then the memory is gone. Dick stands in the doorway shrouded in darkness and silen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheney, Scooter, Addington, Mary Matalin, PAUL WOLFOWITZ, and Rumsfeld all sit in CheneyвЂ™s office.  58.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Scooter, why donвЂ™t you let everyone know the lay of the land?

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY
dialogues.text: Of course. As you all know, IвЂ™m Scooter Libby, DickвЂ™s Chief of Staff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GIANT HAND PUTS A вЂњGEORGE W BUSH GAME PIECEвЂќ (LIKE STRATEGO) DOWN IN THE OVAL OFFICE.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But IвЂ™m also a special adviser to the President. A GAME PIECE OF SCOOTER APPEARS IN THE ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mary Matalin will serve as an adviser to the VP and to Bush. GAME PIECE OF MATALIN APPEARS.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: David Addington, DickвЂ™s main legal counsel, will play center field on all matters relating to executive power. GAME PIECE OF ADDINGTON APPEARS.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The President has Alberto Gonzales, Karl Rove and Karen Hughes as his team. GAME PIECES OF THOSE THREE APPEAR.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Quite frankly Gonzales has no clue, Rove is a hack and Hughes should be in double A ball. Their PIECES GET SWEPT OFF THE BOARD BY A GIANT HAND. BUS NOW SURROUNDED BY CHENEY GAME PIECES.  More GAME Pentagon, 59.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY
dialogues.text: We will be automatically BCCвЂ™d on all emails the President receives or sends. As well as have access to his schedule the second it is set or changed.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: We'll also be receiving the daily intelligence briefing before the President so we can get inside the decision curve.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Jesus. Bush approved all of this?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: We have... an understanding.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: What about the emails? Paper shredders donвЂ™t work with emails.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: The entire administration will run off of the RNCвЂ™s private server.

dialogues.speaker: ADDINGTON
dialogues.text: And we've deactivated automatic archiving. We're clean.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY
dialogues.text: Okay, so over at the Pentagon weвЂ™ve got Don as Secretary of Defense. Paul Wolfowitz, who worked with Team B in the Ford days, as Undersecretary of Defense. PIECES GO ONTO A GAME BOARD that shows the DOJ, White House, and all of DC.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: LetвЂ™s check what kind of plans they have to invade Iraq, okay Paul?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL WOLFOWITZ
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s already in the works.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY
dialogues.text: We've got Ashcroft at the DOJ. State seems to be the only tricky department. ThatвЂ™s Colin Powell and his guy Lawrence Wilkerson.  60.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL WOLFOWITZ
dialogues.text: We've got Bolton over there. HeвЂ™s a loose cannon but loyal.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I want to get Liz in there as well. LetвЂ™s make sure that happens.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY
dialogues.text: Consider it done. (back to business) And this list of вЂњourвЂќ people doesnвЂ™t include about 800 others lobbyists and industry insiders we placed in the regulatory jobs. The game board is flooded with pieces everywhere. Some of them have corporate logos on them.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Hey. What did you do with WвЂ™s friends? Pataki, Ridge, Thompson? I didnвЂ™t hear their names.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: They were not offered jobs in this administration at this time.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: вЂњWere not offered jobs at this time?вЂќ Have you gotten more ruthless Dick!? You must not be getting laid! Beat. It gets uncomfortable for a second.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY
dialogues.text: Moving on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don and Dick walk through the hallways together just like times.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Listen Don, you havenвЂ™t been here in over 20 years. Times have changed. The softer touch is the norm now. We have the conservative radio and TV doing the yelling for us.  61.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Is your old friend embarrassing you? Is that it Dick?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Soft touch, thatвЂ™s all. (looks at watch) Alright. I have to go to my office over at the House of Representatives.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: You mean the Senate? Vice President is the tie breaker in the Senate.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: No. I mean the House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK FLASHES of a car racing around Capital Hill.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Dick Cheney had used an old connection with former wrestling coach and speaker of the house Dennis Hastert to get an office at the House of Representatives. The house is where revenue bills originate and he wanted to be near the money faucet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPED UP TRACKING SHOT down the halls of the Capitol. Tracking stops, door opens. ItвЂ™s DENNIS HASTERT, 60.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS HASTERT
dialogues.text: Hey Dick! Will this work for you? Camera TRACKS AWAY SUPER FAST AGAIN DOWN HALLS TO THE SEN INTERCUT: Curt the Narrator jogging and camera fast track through Capital Hill.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And not one, but two offices at the Senate... Door opens and SENATOR TRENT LOTT is there.  62.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT LOTT
dialogues.text: Hey Dick. I found this extra office for you. Camera tracks away FAST AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: One in the Pentagon... Down a HALLWAY OF THE PENTAGON. OFFICE door opens...

dialogues.speaker: DONALD RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: I picked out this one personally. And I got you a welcoming gift! Reveal a bottle of Glenlivet on the desk. CAMERA SPEEDS AWAY AGAIN down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And later when CheneyвЂ™s team was combing through the intelligence on Iraq, a conference room at the CIA.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA SPEEDS DOWN HALLWAY TO OPEN DOOR. GEORGE TENET 57,
dialogues.text: garrulous head of the CIA stands inside.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE TENET
dialogues.text: The room is soundproof and secure Mr. Vice President. SPEEDS AWAY AGAIN... GAME BOARD: ONE PARTICULAR BUILDING LIGHTS UP.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
