dialogues.text: But there was one relatively new think tank that had become the place to be in Washington DC. Americans for Tax Reform.

dialogues.speaker: HUNDREDS OF GOP CONGRESSMEN, LOBBYISTS AND MEMBERS OF THE
dialogues.text: RIGHT WING MEDIA are seated and waiting.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Grover Norquist ran the anti-tax group with huge funding from the Koch brothers network, big oil and tobacco. Dick and Lynne enter and THE WHOLE ROOM STANDS.  63.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: His Wednesday meeting as it was called had become the center of the Republican world. GROVER NORQUIST, 48, roundish, bearded, starts the meetin

dialogues.speaker: GROVER NORQUIST
dialogues.text: LetвЂ™s talk about the estate tax. This has been hard to eliminate because the tax only applies to estates larger than 2 million dollars. But marketing guru Frank Luntz is here to help... FRANK LUNTZ, 42 and portly stands up.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK LUNTZ
dialogues.text: Hello all. Getting regular people to support cutting taxes for the very wealthy has always been very difficult. But I think weвЂ™ve had a break through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK LUNTZ, 42, stands in front of a DOZEN REGULAR PEOPL

dialogues.speaker: FRANK LUNTZ
dialogues.text: The Estate Tax kicks in for anyone inheriting over $2 Million dollars. How many of you have a problem with that? One guy raises his hand. FRANK LUNTZ (CONTвЂ™D) Now, how many of you would have a problem with someone called a вЂњdeath tax?вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: ALL TWELVE HANDS GO UP
dialogues.text: Frank turns to the two-way mirror to give a DOUBLE thumbs Then we flash to another focus group already in progress. FRANK LUNTZ (CONTвЂ™D) Instead of global warming, which we all agree sounds very scary, we call it... climate change?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Track past cars, hearing their RADIOS. A mixture of sport talk, classic rock and a fair amount of RIGHT WING RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPPETS OF TALK RADIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Folks, the government is taking your money AFTER you die!... ItвЂ™s a death tax... Death tax... The liberals want you to pay a tax when you die! etc.

dialogues.speaker: WEB PAGES
dialogues.text: NEWS MAX: вЂњDEATH TAX MUST GO!вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt the Narrator plays on the floor with his son while M makes lunch in the kitchen. Reports on the Death Tax blar on the TV with our BLONDE ANCHOR at the desk.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (SOT)
dialogues.text: The liberals would tax you for laughing or crying if they could.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: So with one of the biggest media and political machines every created behind him, Cheney was able to squash action Global Warming, cut taxes for the super rich and gut regulations for massive corporations.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER
dialogues.text: And then there was CheneyвЂ™s National Energy Policy Development Group. His first major test to expand executive power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Libby, Addington and Cheney sit in CheneyвЂ™s office.  65.

dialogues.speaker: DICK CHENEY
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t understand what the goddamn problem is! I want to hear what the energy CEOs need and IвЂ™m not allowed to?

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s called FACA.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: What the hell is FACA?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ADDINGTON
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s the Federal Advisory Committees Act. Congress got their panties in a bunch that elected officials would just let CEOs roll in and, you know, write the laws.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY
dialogues.text: The Act demands that appropriate government officials be present. Tense beat

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Hold on a second. Addington picks up the phone and dials. DAVID ADDINGTON (CONTвЂ™D) Hello? WhatвЂ™s your name?... Doug? Doug, how long have you been working reception at the Department of Energy? Three months? Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU: NAME TAG READING вЂњDOUG.вЂќ Some guy in a MenвЂ™s Wa suit, DOUG, 24, sitting in the corner of a conference roo

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: So what am I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Just sit there and be quiet. Cheney and Addington sit at the large table very far away Two men walk in, FACES PIXILATED AND VOICES DISTORTED.  66.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Hello (BEEP) and (BEEP). HowвЂ™s business at (BEEP)?

dialogues.speaker: OTHER MAN
dialogues.text: We're good. (BEEP) has been performing quite well and (BEEP) and (BEEP) are quite optimistic. They all shake hands and have a seat.

dialogues.speaker: ADDINGTON
dialogues.text: (pointing to Doug) Oh, heвЂ™s with the Energy Department. Doug now listening to music on his head phones gives a chipper thumbs up. INT. ENVIRONMENTAL GROUPвЂ™S HEADQUARTERS - DAY CU of hands opening a large envelope and removing copies maps that are laid on a table.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The details of Cheney's meetings with the energy CEO's were never disclosed. CU on a MAP OF ALL THE IRAQI OIL FIELDS with OIL COMPANIE NAMES ON THEM...

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: But a freedom of information request did provide some documents, including a map of Iraq's oil fields with all of the oil companies that would be interested in acquiring them if вЂњsomehowвЂќ they were ever to become available. We pan over the map. Seeing names like Exxon, BP, Shell e NARRATOR (CONTвЂ™D) And then, it happened.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: TV SCREEN: ACTUAL DiTech Commercial for mortgage consolidation that was playing on 9/11, is interrupted by BREAKING NEWS.  67.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This just in, you are looking at a very disturbing live shot. That is the World Trade Center and we have unconfirmed reports that a plane has crashed into one of the towers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheney, Condi Rice and Mary Matalin are watching CNN. ONE

dialogues.speaker: THE TWIN TOWERS IS SMOKING. SUDDENLY A SECOND PLANE SOARS
dialogues.text: INTO FRAME AND HITS THE OTHER TOWER. Everyone gasps.

dialogues.speaker: CNN ANCHOR, (SOT)
dialogues.text: Oh my God! That was a second plane! A second plane has hit the south tower!! SECRET SERVICE AGENTS rush in.

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: Mr. Vice President, we have credible information that a plane is headed for the White House at this moment. We have less than a minute to get to the secure underground bunker. Cheney is transfixed by the smoking towers. He doesnвЂ™t SECRET SERVICE AGENT (CONTвЂ™D) LetвЂ™s MOVE!!

dialogues.speaker: THE SECRET SERVICE AGENT GRABS CHENEY BY THE BELT AND LIF
dialogues.text: HIM OFF THE GROUND. Everyone rushes to the door and down stairs. They make their way into a Cold War era bunker. T Secret Service Agent straggles behind with another AGENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TV in a hair salon shows that the Pentagon has also bee hit. Lynne is there arguing with her SECRET SERVICE detai

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: But Mrs. Cheney IвЂ™m being told no one is to go to the White House. ItвЂ™s not safe.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: I said, you take me to the White House!  68. Sirens blare in the background as Secret Service escorts Lynne to a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheney, on the phone amidst the chaos, Norman Mineta, Addington, Condi Rice, Scooter Libby and Karen Hughes and few others are there.

dialogues.speaker: STAFFER
dialogues.text: That's right. WeвЂ™ve got planes in the air and no where for them to land. Permission for them to land in Canadian Airports. International flights into Newfoundland. Dick hangs up a call with the President.

dialogues.speaker: STAFFER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sir, Don Rumsfeld on 3. Cheney points to the speaker phone.

dialogues.speaker: CHENEY
dialogues.text: That? He picks up the line.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: You have authorization to shoot down any aircraft deemed a threat. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Presidential authority?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s correct. All orders are UNODIR. Condi and the Staffer make eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN HUGHES
dialogues.text: Unless otherwise directed.

dialogues.speaker: CONDI RICE
dialogues.text: Mr. Vice President are we sure these are the proper rules of engagement.  69.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: The countryвЂ™s under attack, the ROE is fluid. David?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Yes Mr. Vice President. Addington leans to Cheney. They talk in hushed tones.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now we don't know what exactly what the people in that room were thinking, but it's safe to assume that at least one person wondered why, in the midst of the most fateful day in American history, was Dick Cheney talking to his lawyer? Karen Hughes tries to get CheneyвЂ™s attention.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN HUGHES
dialogues.text: (gets off another phone) ..-Mr. Vice President, the Congressional Members you sent to Mount Weather Emergency Operations Center want to leave.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN HUGHES
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: They're not going anywhere. Just tell them, weвЂ™ve got all the helicopters.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN HUGHES
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. CLIP: The Twin Towers crumble to the ground. Lynne leans into Dick.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Are we at war?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Yes we are.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: With who?  70. Dick clasps his hands and considers the question. L/3 вЂњThe Unitary ExecutiveвЂќ STOCK: EXT. New York People running through the streets covered in ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W Bush, Cheney, Rumsfeld, Colin Powell, RICHARD CLARKE 53 Scooter Libby, Condi and George Tenet all convene.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE TENET
dialogues.text: We've picked up chatter from well- known Al Qaeda operatives celebrating todayвЂ™s attack.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: We shouldnвЂ™t rule out Iraq.

dialogues.speaker: CONDI RICE
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s Al QaedaвЂ™s LeaderвЂ™s name?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE TENET
dialogues.text: His name is Osama Bin Laden

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD CLARKE
dialogues.text: But this is clearly Al Qaeda. IвЂ™ve been tracking their movements for years. TheyвЂ™re fingerprints are all over this.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Iraq has all the good targets.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD CLARKE
dialogues.text: Iraq has NOTHING to do with this.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Richard you donвЂ™t know that for sure--

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD CLARKE
dialogues.text: I do know that.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN POWELL
dialogues.text: Mr. President, if I may, Afghanistan is Al QaedaвЂ™s headquarters. This is where our focus should be. L/3 вЂњColin Powell: Secretary of StateвЂќ  71.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE TENET
dialogues.text: And the CIA would be capable of taking down the TalibanвЂ™s power structure.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: With all do respect, George. Mr. President. We are the Pentagon. This is what we do.

dialogues.speaker: CHENEY
dialogues.text: Don... Bush looks around the room. Uncertain for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: Okay... WeвЂ™ll go with Tenet and the CIA for now. Tenet gives Rumsfeld a glance. Don is not happy.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN POWELL
dialogues.text: IвЂ™'ll make calls to our allies. Everyone gets up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I think given the current situation Mr. President, itвЂ™s wise that you and I not be in the same location. For, uh, COG...Continuity of Government.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: (he looks freaked) Of course, of course... Hey... Are we going to be alright?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Yes sir. We are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LARGE HELICOPTER TAKES OFF. Two SECRET SERVICE AGENTS holding machine guns stand and watch.

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: (into his mic) Angler has taken off to an undisclosed location. I repeat, Angler is airborn.  72.

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: Angler? ThatвЂ™s the VP? I thought only the President could land and take off from the south lawn?

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: What can I tell you? TodayвЂ™s fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick, Lynne, A MARINE GUARD and a DOCTOR are in a small c GOING DOWN AND DOWN INTO THE DARKNESS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intel Officers, NSC members surround a table. CHENEY IS O SCREEN OR SVTS (sivits), TELECONFERENCING IN FROM AN UNDISCLOSED LOCATION.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: This intelligence has been edited, redacted and reduced.

dialogues.speaker: INTELLIGENCE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Mr. Vice President, usually we vet the daily intelligence threat matrix to eliminate unreliable sources, non-players-

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (SOT)
dialogues.text: Stop. DonвЂ™t you dare give me a damn disquisition on what I cannot hear.

dialogues.speaker: INTELLIGENCE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Mr. President a lot of this information is not verified.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: This is the last time I'll say it. I want to hear everything. Every day. From now on. SLOW PUSH IN ON CHENEYвЂ™S FACE AS HE HEARS THE RAW INTEL READ BY THE GROUP. The collage of intel becomes denser an denser, mixed with static ridden Arabic and other languag

dialogues.speaker: VOICES
dialogues.text: We're tracking the possibility of Bio-attacks using serin gas, cow pox, ebola... There was a post on a dark web site about mass be- headings in residential neighborhoods.... Plans were found outlining the use of infants as suicide bombs in major airports... A source has told as asset about fire bombs targeting hospitals... A video was captured describing televised executions interrupting American network TV... Movie studios, museums, subways, day care centers may all be targets... etc. As we get to a grainy close up of CheneyвЂ™s eyes on the we see something that hasnвЂ™t been apparent before: FEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynne and Dick lay in bed in a giant DARK CAVERN with spa furniture and telecommunications equipment.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m scared Dick...

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ll always keep you safe.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: What are you going to do? In the darkness Cheney is just a black silhouette. FLASH TO: A stream. Cheney stands in it fishing. BY A ROC UNDER THE WATER IS THE SHADOW OF A HORRIBLE CREATURE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VFX: CHEST POUNDING EXPLOSIONS dot a mountainside in Afghanistan as US FIGHTER JETS screech across the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5 US SOLDIERS lead a row of 12 TALIBAN PRISONERS towards old stone wall. The Taliban fighters are dirty and dusty look spent. One of the US SOLDIERS IS OUR NARRATOR TALKIN CAMERA. HE HAS ENLISTED.  74.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: So while Powell, the CIA and their international coalition toppled the Taliban and took Afghanistan in a matter of days... Cheney had found something much more powerful than missiles or jet planes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign: вЂњThe Office of Legal Counsel.вЂќ David Addington across from two OLC LAWYERS. Cheney TELECONFERENCES in.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Mr. Vice President, this is John Yoo. JOHN YOO, 34, an Asian American lawyer with a deliberate professional manner sits across from them. JAY BYBEE, 48, Assistant Attorney General for the OLC is next to Yoo.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN YOO
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s a pleasure to meet you Mr. Vice President.

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (SOT)
dialogues.text: Mmm huh.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ADDINGTON
dialogues.text: The Vice President believes that it is the duty as Commander in Chief to protect that Nation. And that no other obligation whether it be Congress or existing treaties supersedes that duty... How do you feel about that statement? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN YOO
dialogues.text: I couldn't agree more.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC
dialogues.text: INT. JOHN YOOвЂ™S OFFICE - DAY John Yoo is at the computer. David Addington paces. Occasionally Bybee walks in with case files.  75.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: John YooвЂ™s first legal opinion allowed the US government to monitor every citizenвЂ™s phone calls, texts and emails without a warrant. It was a giant legal leap based on sketchy law at best. QUICK CUT: Soldiers punch prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: But their masterpiece, their Moby Dick if you will, was the torture memo. QUICK CUT: Prisoners are pushed into boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheney, Addington, W Bush, Tenet and Rumsfeld.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE TENET
dialogues.text: But what about the Geneva Convention?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: We believe the Geneva Convention is open to... interpretation.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE TENET
dialogues.text: What exactly does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: ADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Stress positions, water boarding, confined spaces, dogs.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: We're calling it enhanced interrogation.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™re sure none of this fits under the definition of torture?

dialogues.speaker: ADDINGTON
dialogues.text: The U.S. doesnвЂ™t torture.

dialogues.speaker: CHENEY
dialogues.text: Therefore, if the U.S. does it, by definition, it canвЂ™t be torture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1. A MIDDLE EASTERN MAN naked and being water boarded. He howls and cries.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLATOR
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Just tell us what targets are next! What targets are next?! 2. The CLERIC from the beginning having his genitals shoc with wires. He screams as much as a person can scream.

dialogues.speaker: CIA AGENT
dialogues.text: All of this ends the second you tell us the truth!!

dialogues.speaker: SCREAMS AT HIM.
dialogues.text: CIA AGENT (CONTвЂ™D) We will rape and kill your wife and children! Do you fucking hear me!!?

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLATOR
dialogues.text: (Translates in Arabic) A TRANSLATOR yells the translation. The Man, his family S

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: But torture and privacy laws werenвЂ™t the only laws Cheney rewrote with John Yoo. They had a full menu of opinions challenging Constitutional and International law,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fancy WAITER, 54, lists the specials to Cheney, Rumsfel Wolfowitz and Addington at a lavish table.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: (formal and dispassionate) Tonight we are offering the enemy combatant: whereby someone is not a criminal or a prisoner of war. Which gives them no protection under the law. We are also have Extreme Rendition where suspects are abducted without record, on foreign soil and taken to foreign prisons in countries that torture. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: WAITER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have Guantanamo Bay which is very, very complicated but allows you to operate outside the purview of due process on land that isnвЂ™t technically US soil, but is under our control.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: That sounds delicious!

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: And there is a very fresh and delicious War Powers Act interpretation, which gives the executive branch broad power to attack any country or person that might possibly be a threat. Finally for desert we have the fact that under the unitary executive theory if the President does anything it makes it legal. In other words you can do whatever the fuck you want. So which would you like gentlemen?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: We'll have them all.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Excellent choice. They hand the Waiter their menus.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL WOLFOWITZ
dialogues.text: Look Dick, weвЂ™ve been using focus groups and advertising executives to help us sell this war on terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOCUS GROUP LEADER, 34, an upbeat woman talks to a DOZEN AMERICAN MEN AND WOMEN OF MIXED AGES.

dialogues.speaker: FOCUS GROUP LEADER
dialogues.text: I do want to reiterate, we are still being recorded and there still may or may not be clients behind the door.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL WOLFOWITZ
dialogues.text: These guys are pretty sharp.  78.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s a problem. The results show that people are confused.

dialogues.speaker: FOCUS GROUP LEADER
dialogues.text: So you're saying you support the President and you hate terrorism, but youвЂ™re confused. Can you tell me why? A 60 YEAR OLD MAN in a football jersey answers.

dialogues.speaker: YEAR OLD GUY
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t we just have to get Osama bin Laden? He did it. So why are they calling it a war? A war with who? 19 YR OLD GIRL in a half tee raises her hand.

dialogues.speaker: FOCUS GROUP LEADER
dialogues.text: Thank you Mark. Yes Jasmine?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD GIRL
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t get what this Al Qaeda is. Are they a country? Why canвЂ™t we just bomb them?

dialogues.speaker: FOCUS GROUP LEADER
dialogues.text: Interesting. Who else isnвЂ™t entirely sure what Al Queda is? Most hands go up. ON SCREEN: These focus groups happened in February 2002. were overseen by the Pentagon and headed by PR and Market execs. FOCUS GROUP LEADER (CONTвЂ™D) Would it be less confusing if it was a country?

dialogues.speaker: YEAR OLD GUY
dialogues.text: Damn right. IвЂ™m angry as hell. We gotta fuck someone up.

dialogues.speaker: FOCUS GROUP LEADER
dialogues.text: Really strong feelings from Mark, IвЂ™m interested. Who agrees with this statement?  Most hands go up.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL WOLFOWITZ
dialogues.text: They know weвЂ™re at war but they donвЂ™t understand against who.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: They want a country. ItвЂ™s simpler. Cleaner.

dialogues.speaker: ADDINGTON
dialogues.text: That would certainly help us legally. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Looks like itвЂ™s time to take Iraq. They all smile and laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheney talks with W Bush.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s called the Office of Special Plans. Tenet is not yet serious enough about the threat Saddam poses in the GWOt, or global war on terror. But I can promise you this intelligence group will be.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve been wanting to take that motherfucker Saddam down for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 167 A half dozen of CheneyвЂ™s people work at desks, reading writing at the OFFICE OF SPECIAL PLANS: WILLIAM LUTI, DOU FEITH, ABRAM SHULSKY, and Paul Wolfowitz barking out orde  80.

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS FEITH
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve got something! HereвЂ™s a report that Mohamed Atta one of the hijackers may have met with an Iraqi spy in Prague.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Wait, we canвЂ™t just bomb people.

dialogues.speaker: GUY IN HIS SIXTIES
dialogues.text: Give me a break!

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS FEITH
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s from Czech intelligence and they question its credibility...

dialogues.speaker: PAUL WOLFOWITZ
dialogues.text: I've been to Prague. They question everything. (to the room) Who wants to be an вЂњunnamed source?вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS FEITH
dialogues.text: Make sure to get in the phrase вЂњwe donвЂ™t want the smoking gun to be a mushroom cloud.вЂќ It focus grouped through the roof!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Condi Rice is being interviewed by Wolf Blitzer.

dialogues.speaker: CONDI RICE
dialogues.text: The problem with Saddam is that there will always be uncertainty about when he will acquire nuclear weapons. But we donвЂ™t want the smoking gun to be a mushroom cloud. CUT TO: SNIPPETS OF CSPAN, CNN, ABC, CBS. Various Politic across party lines supporting the war on Iraq.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF SESSIONS, (SOT)
dialogues.text: (on TV) В«whether itвЂ™s a smoking gun or a mushroom cloud.  81.

dialogues.speaker: CHENEY
dialogues.text: (on TV) There is no question that Saddam Hussien has Weapons of Mass distruction. BILL OвЂ™REILLY (SOT) (on TV) We gotta get rid of this dictator. HeвЂ™s got anthrax. HeвЂ™s got all these weapons.

dialogues.speaker: REP. MIKE PENCE
dialogues.text: (on TV) And not if, but when, Saddam uses weapons of mass destruction, what will we tell the American People.

dialogues.speaker: SEN. HILLARY RODHAM CLINTON, (SOT)
dialogues.text: (on TV) Saddam Hussien will increase his capacity to wage biological and chemical warfare.

dialogues.speaker: PM TONY BLAIR, (SOT)
dialogues.text: (on TV) .-we will stand up for what we know to be right. To show that we will confront the tyrannies and dictatorships and terrorists who put our way of life at risk.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF PROBST, (SOT)
dialogues.text: The tribe has spoken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President, Rove, Condi, George Tenet, Hughes, Powell, Cheney and Rumsfeld are all talking about the war.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN HUGHES
dialogues.text: Polling for an invasion of Iraq is at 53%. Focus groups show people still arenвЂ™t sure about a connection between Saddam and Al Qaeda.  82.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: France and Germany have said they won't join the coalition. Neither will Israel. Cheney is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: We went to the wall together. We prayed together. Israel is one of our closest allies.

dialogues.speaker: RICE
dialogues.text: They said an invasion of Iraq would destabilize the region, Sir. And they donвЂ™t view Saddam as an immediate threat.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s not good. I really want a strong coalition for this.

dialogues.speaker: KARL ROVE
dialogues.text: I have an idea. Secretary Powell has the highest trustworthy ratings of any of us. What if he gave an address to the U.N. and the American people to push this over the finish line?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN POWELL
dialogues.text: Karl, IвЂ™ve been very vocal, very vocal, about my reservations about invading Iraq.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Oh Colin, youвЂ™re such a nervous Nellie.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN POWELL
dialogues.text: We're talking about invading a sovereign nation without provocation Don!

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Oh, sovereign nation...

dialogues.speaker: COLIN POWELL RUMSFELD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What about the intelligence. Oh come on! You know youвЂ™r Has anybody thought about the wrong, you're just a chicke intelligence? You break it, shit. you bought it. You break it, you bought it!  83.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE W
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey, alright. LetвЂ™s slow down. ThatвЂ™s enough of that guys. Dick is next to W across the room. He speaks to him quiet

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Are you going to take Saddam down or not. You're the President. War is yours. Not the U.N. Or some coalition. Do not share powers that are yours alone. After a quarter beat W turns back to the group.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE W
dialogues.text: George, make sure Powell sees the intelligence. Colin I want you to make that speech. IвЂ™m the President and I want this to happen!

dialogues.speaker: COLIN POWELL
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I look forward to being briefed on that intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE TENET
dialogues.text: On another note, IвЂ™ve been handed a credible report that thereвЂ™s a small terrorist enclave in Northeastern Iraq. If weвЂ™re going to invade we recommend taking it out before.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Let it go, George, we have bigger fish to fry. Dick pulls Tenet aside.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Excuse me George. May I see that intelligence?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE TENET
dialogues.text: Of course. FREEZE: as the report is handed to Cheney.  84.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That classified document described a terrorist named Abu Musab Al- Zarqawi who had started as a drug dealer and pimp before becoming fully radicalized in a Jordanian prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zarqawi walks toward OSAMA BIN LADEN. They sit and talk.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Zarqawi went to meet Bin Laden in Afghanistan. But Zarqawi had vowed to kill all Shia Muslims and Bin Laden's mother was Shia, so the meeting didnвЂ™t go well

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Did he or did he not meet with Al Qaeda?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CIA ANALYST
dialogues.text: They had no operational contact.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Hogwash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell storms down the hallway holding some papers. He st COLONEL WILKERSON, 57, PowellвЂ™s Chief of Staff at State

dialogues.speaker: COLIN POWELL
dialogues.text: Larry have you read this speech?!

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE WILKERSON
dialogues.text: Yes. ItвЂ™s beyond thin. I saw five pieces of disproved intel in there.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN POWELL
dialogues.text: Who wrote it?  85.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE WILKERSON
dialogues.text: They claimed it was from the President but I think you can guess who really wrote it. INT. SCOOTER LIBBYвЂ™S OFFICE - DAY Scooter on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s no need to yell Larry. Yes, we reviewed the speech and gave some notes... David Addington enters and silently listens.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ADDINGTON
dialogues.text: Powell really doesnвЂ™t have a clue does he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zarqawi and some of his followers clean their guns and ta

dialogues.text: After the US invaded Afghanistan Zarqawi set up shop in Iraq. It was the only connection Cheney had between Al Qaeda and Iraq, and Cheney made sure ZarqawiвЂ™s name was all over PowellвЂ™s speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: JOSCHKA FISCHER
dialogues.text: The Security Counsel will now begin its consideration of item 2 of the agenda. I now call the distinguished Secretary of State of the United States Mr. Colin Powell.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN POWELL
dialogues.text: My purpose today is to share with you what the United States knows about Iraq's weapons of mass destruction as well as Iraq's involvement in terrorism...  86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zarqawi and five other TERRORISTS watch Powell on a lapto

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: (on TV) Iraq today harbors a deadly terrorist network headed by Abu Musab Zarqawi, an associate and collaborator of Osama Bin Laden and his Al Qaeda lieutenants.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: PowellвЂ™s UN Address was seen by millions of Americas. But other people were watching as well.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: (on TV) Zarqawi's activities are not confined to this corner of Northeast Iraq.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The great general of America saying his name over and over again immediately made Zarqawi a star.

dialogues.speaker: ZARQAWI
dialogues.text: Allah Akbar!

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Within a day he had gone into hiding.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER TERRORISTS
dialogues.text: Allah Akbar! Allah Akbar!

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: .В«-.an Al-Qaeda source tells us that Saddam and bin Laden reached an understanding that Al-Qaeda would no longer support activities against Baghdad.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: By the time we invaded Iraq 70% of Americans thought that Saddam Hussein was involved in 9/11. Powell shuffles his papers.  87.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Later Colin Powell would call the speech the most shameful moment of his life.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ DICK, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Ok, we arenвЂ™t going to revisit your fatherвЂ™s colorful conversation.

dialogues.speaker: W BUSH
dialogues.text: My fellow citizens, at this hour, American and coalition forces are in the early stages of military operations to disarm Iraq, to free its people and to defend the world from grave danger. On my orders, coalition forces have begun striking selected targets of military importance to undermine Saddam Hussein's ability to wage war. These are opening stages of what will be a broad and concerted campaign. To all of the men and women of the United States armed forces now in the Middle East, the peace of a troubled world and the hopes of an oppressed people now depend on you. W BushвЂ™s leg bops up and down nervously under the desk.

dialogues.speaker: WOLFOWITZ

Tilt down to reveal lawyer, 78, HARRY WHITTINGTON with blood all over his fac It is a hunting group: PAMELA WILLEFORD, Cheney, holding smoking gun, a RANCH HAND, SECRET SERVICE AGENTS and OTHE sitting in town cars parked across from the hunting blind

dialogues.text: To this day, Dick Cheney has never apologized for this incident. KATHERINE ARMSTRONG, late 50вЂ™s and her sister run up.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE ARMSTRONG
dialogues.text: Jesus Dick.. CU OF AN EMPTY BEER CAN.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But, someone else did.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY WHITTINGTON
dialogues.text: My family and I are deeply sorry for all that Vice President Cheney and his family have had to go through this past week. We send our love and respect to them. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

Cheney and Scooter look at the famous Op-ed in the NY Tim by Joe Wilson questioning the yellowcake intel.

dialogues.text: Okay, okay, like... they donвЂ™t care about their dogs. TheyвЂ™1l shoot em, let em run wild... What kind of people donвЂ™t love a dog?

dialogues.text: Linda-

dialogues.text: Look at this crap.

dialogues.text: That report says Zarqawi, the same fucking Zarqawi we talked up for months, is leading a major insurgency in Iraq. And the implication is itвЂ™s because we talked him up! He hands Cheney a CIA CLASSIFIED BRIEFING. Flashes of wor вЂњbuilding insurgencyвЂќ вЂњZarqawiвЂќ вЂњusing former I вЂњZarqawiвЂќ and once again, вЂњZarqawi.вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: No I intercepted it before it got across the hallway. Libby is now reading it.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER LIBBY
dialogues.text: This is generated by an analyst.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Get me Tenet. This stops here.  93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE ANCIENT CITY LOOKS NORMAL, with traffic, and yes, a military presence but still, fairly hum drum.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Abu Musab Al-Zarqawi had taken his fame from Powell's UN speech and taken it into his own new thing. An explosion erupts in the distance. We hear sirens.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Islamic state of Iraq and Levant, or ISIS. Another explosion in the distance. More sirens.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And because that intelligence somehow found itself on the bottom of a stack of papers, Zarqawi had a whole year to do whatever the hell he wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pan off a blood stained and blackened wall of a subway and down to the floor where a blood smear from a body bei dragged makes it way across the floor. There is a briefca with scattered papers, a purse, a childвЂ™s lunch box and and a severed hand laying about.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: And what he wanted was carnage. We follow the smear down the aisle and out to the door wh it meets the platform and becomes dirt and blood mixed together. We see the legs of 2 POLICE OFFICERS IN THE BACKGROUND.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Shia versus Sunni, the West versus Islam and death versus life. EXT. SADDAM HUSSEINвЂ™S PALACE - BEDROOM - DAY Next to a giant bed, a shelf full of dusty VHS tapes of American movies.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And on top of that US forces couldn't find any WMD's or nuclear programs in Iraq. Pan past copies of RED HEAT, TURNER AND HOOTCH etc.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheney walks through the crowded Senate floor, shaking ha

dialogues.text: Vice President Cheney is being sued by Valerie Plame and her husband Joseph Wilson.... The White House announced four cabinet resignations... A Dem Senator PATRICK LEAHY, 60's approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK LEAHY
dialogues.text: Hey Dick. I hope thereвЂ™s no hard feelings about us investigating the no-bid Iraq contracts for Halliburton. Just doing my job. Cheney turns to him with his crooked smile.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Go fuck yourself. EXT. NATIONALвЂ™S BALL PARK - DAY Dick Cheney, wearing a Nationals jacket comes exits the dugout to throw out the first pitch. The crowd boos Cheney.

dialogues.text: Some nations accusing Bush and Cheney of war crimes... There is a chorus of people calling for Dick Cheney to step aside and resign. The AIDE reaches the end of the hallway, knocks on a door

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Go_away! The Aide turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Cheney is on the phone in his study. Cut back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: I wanted a clean phone line so IвЂ™m in an empty office. Listen, if we can just get an air bombardment in Iraq, it'll make a statement and give us political cover-

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s over Don.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s that?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s over. The President wants you to step down. He appreciates your service. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Does BushвЂ™s kid want me out or do you? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I canвЂ™t win every fight Don.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: You are a little piece of shit. Beat.  96.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wow, how did you become such a cold son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry Don. I really am.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: You know how I know youвЂ™re not? (beat) Because I wouldnвЂ™t be. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you think theyвЂ™1l prosecute us? Long beat.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: ...Okay then.

dialogues.speaker: RUMSFELD
dialogues.text: Okay then. Rumsfeld hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE INAUGURATION OF BARACK OBAMA. Cheney, in a wheelchair and W Bush walk out for the ceremonial changing of power (STOCK FOOTAGE/HEAD REPLACEMENT) .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: A few years later, DickвЂ™s heart trouble started up again. With no donor available, he finally found himself at deathвЂ™s door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheney, looking very thin is in a hospital bed with Mary, and Lynne around him. A DOCTOR is there.  97.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I wish I had better news. Your heart just isnвЂ™t pumping enough oxygen to keep his vital organs alive. Should I call for a Minister?

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: No. HeвЂ™s not going anywhere. Dick Cheney you are not going anywhere, do you hear me?!

dialogues.speaker: DICK CHENEY
dialogues.text: (raspy) This may be the one time I canвЂ™t do what your Mother says. The family laughs while crying.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I love you Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
